name: TFPT v2.5 canonical microscopic action (UFE + SM sector)

ufe_action.label: UFEaction
ufe_action.excerpt_lines_hint: around L930–L944 in the TeX source

notes: This JSON is intended as the single canonical action/field-content spec consumed by the TFPT suite.
Pieces that are not explicitly fixed in the paper are included as placeholders and must be replaced by derived expressions to reach 'robust' QFT completeness.

hypercharge.normalization: SM normalization (not GUT-normalized): Q = T3 + Y
hypercharge.note: RG modules may internally apply GUT normalization when needed (e.g. g1 = sqrt(5/3) g_Y).

maxwell.note: Matches paper Maxwell convention: do not use F_AB = 2 ∇̂_[A A_{B}] in the U(1) sector.

torsion.connection_decomposition: Γ̂ = Γ(ĝ) + K, with torsion T^A_{BC} := 2 Γ̂^A_[BC]
torsion.irreps_4d: Torsion decomposed into (S_μ axial, T_μ trace, q_{μνρ} tensor) in the 4D effective theory.

gauge_groups.name: U1_EM
gauge_groups.note: UFE electromagnetic U(1) in the paper’s UFE Action

axions.name: a_top
axions.note: Topological axion background (birefringence). In the UFE action this corresponds to the field 'a' in c3 a F\tilde{F}.

axions.name: a_QCD
axions.note: QCD axion (dark matter). Included for completeness; see paper two-field axion structure.

optional_anomaly_neutral_extensions.name: SigmaF
optional_anomaly_neutral_extensions.note: Type-III seesaw style (real rep; Y=0) => anomaly-neutral.

optional_anomaly_neutral_extensions.name: G8
optional_anomaly_neutral_extensions.note: Color adjoint Majorana-style (real rep; Y=0) => anomaly-neutral.

Yu.note: To be derived from Möbius/Z3 mechanism; currently treated as input/ansatz in the suite.

Yd.note: To be derived from Möbius/Z3 mechanism; currently treated as input/ansatz in the suite.

Ye.note: To be derived from Möbius/Z3 mechanism; currently treated as input/ansatz in the suite.

Mpl.note: Input scale; TFPT fixes ratios via invariants, not M_Pl itself.

M_R2.note: TFPT predicts M/M_Pl = sqrt(8*pi)*c3^4 under K1–K4 + GR renorm condition.

alpha_R_K4.note: Coefficient in the Laplace-type closure E = alpha_R * R used for the torsion quadratic operator on a 4D constant-curvature background. Fixed by the K4 closure equation (see generated effective_action_r2_operator_spec.json).

quantization.path_integral_measure: Dg DΓ̂ D(K,T,...) DA Da D(ghosts) (background-field quantization; local counterterms captured by heat-kernel coefficients)

torsion_sector.closure: minimal Laplace-type operator on a 4D constant-curvature background
torsion_sector.note: This is the explicit closure used by the suite for Appendix K.2; a full first-principles derivation from the torsionful connection action remains a separate theory task.

ghosts.name: fp_ghost_vector
ghosts.note: FP ghost associated with the chosen torsion-sector gauge fixing in the effective_action_r2 closure.

brst.note: BRST/gauge-fixing + FP ghost sector is encoded at the closure level and deterministically propagated into the generated OperatorSpec (effective_action_r2_operator_spec.json) from this canonical action spec. A deeper first-principles derivation starting from the full torsionful connection action (beyond the closure-level quadratic operator used in-suite) remains future work.

ufe_action_terms.name: torsion_sector
ufe_action_terms.density: sqrt(-g) * [ 1/2 T^μ(-∇^2 + alpha_R R)T_μ + 1/2 S^μ(-∇^2 + alpha_R R)S_μ + 1/2 q^{μνρ}(-∇^2 + alpha_R R)q_{μνρ}  -  (\bar{c}^μ ∇^2 c_μ) ]
ufe_action_terms.note: Explicit torsion-sector quadratic closure used by the suite for the one-loop heat-kernel evaluation (Appendix K.2). The corresponding block operator (+ FP ghost) is generated deterministically into tfpt_suite/data/effective_action_r2_operator_spec.json.

ufe_action_terms.name: a_top_potential
ufe_action_terms.note: Concrete choice for V is model-dependent; paper provides a minimal shifted periodic completion as one realization.

sm_terms_4d.name: sm_fermion_kinetic
sm_terms_4d.density: Σ_ψ i ψ^† \bar{σ}^μ D_μ ψ  (left-handed Weyl basis)

sm_terms_4d.name: sm_yukawas
sm_terms_4d.density: - ( Q H u_c * Y_u + Q H^† d_c * Y_d + L H^† e_c * Y_e + h.c. )
sm_terms_4d.note: The suite currently uses deterministic ansätze; mechanism-level derivation from Möbius/Z3 is still pending.

gravity_effective_4d.name: r2_starobinsky_completion
gravity_effective_4d.note: M_R2 is derived in-suite from the torsion-sector quadratic closure via heat-kernel a2 bookkeeping (effective_action_r2 module), with the closure operator generated from this microscopic spec.
